intro: Centaurea cineraria var. saratoi, commonly known as the Saratov fumewort, is a variant of the common fumewort. It is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia, characterized by its silver-gray foliage and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The varietal form saratoi is distinguished by specific morphological traits that set it apart from the typical Centaurea cineraria.
